intro: Hemizonia greeneana var. peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
